elements.title: Daniela Melchior (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that actress Daniela Melchior (pictured) once did a chemistry screen test with fancy rats?

elements.title: Ring of Nestor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that scholar Martin P. Nilsson called the Ring of Nestor "a most amazing find", but later doubted its authenticity?

elements.title: Ken Selby (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ken Selby walked along U.S. Route 66 from Oklahoma City to Tulsa at the age of 73?

elements.title: Baltimore classification (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that viruses can be catalogued into seven groups in the Baltimore classification?

elements.title: a subculture from Asian-American gangs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a subculture from Asian-American gangs broadened to include women in college sororities and cultural clubs?

elements.title: The Republic Newspaper Office (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Republic Newspaper Office was completed under budget despite the plans undergoing more than 100 changes during construction?

elements.title: My Time at Sandrock (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the video game My Time at Sandrock was funded by almost 10,000 people from more than 160 countries?

elements.title: William J. Fox (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Brigadier General William J. Fox retired from the U.S. Marine Corps Reserve, moved to Mexico and became a charro?

elements.title: HMAS Emu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that HMAS Emu once rescued a cigarette-smoking chimpanzee and his magician owner?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
